components.description: Prescription glasses, shown with a variety of frames, depending on platform.
components.title: Eyeglasses

description: Prescription glasses, shown with a variety of frames, depending on platform.
title: Eyeglasses

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Clothing and accessories
emoji_net_data.definition: Prescription glasses, shown with a variety of frames, depending on platform. Glasses was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the n http://emojipedia.org/eyeglasses/
emoji_net_data.name: glasses

bn:00110789a: Showing mental alertness and calculation and resourcefulness

bn:00087940v: To gauge, estimate or judge by eye; to look or glance at.

bn:00093430v: Perceive by sight or have the power to perceive by sight
To perceive by the visual faculty.
To perceive or detect with the eyes, or as if by sight.
To see, or to look at.

bn:00029580n: A person who has an unusual, peculiar, or odd personality, or behaviour pattern.
A person with an unusual or odd personality

bn:00032559n: Normal use of the faculty of vision

bn:00000677n: Clothing that is worn or carried, but not part of your main clothing.
An article of clothing or equipment, in particular when used as an accessory.
Clothing that is worn or carried, but not part of your main clothing

bn:03577942n: Eyewear consists of items and accessories worn on or over the eyes, for fashion or adornment, protection against the environment, and to improve or enhance visual acuity.

bn:00032547n: Glasses, also known as eyeglasses or spectacles, are frames bearing lenses worn in front of the eyes.
A pair of lenses set in a frame worn on the nose and ears in order to correct deficiencies in eyesight or to ornament the face.
A pair of lenses set in a frame.
Optical instrument consisting of a frame that holds a pair of lenses for correcting defective vision
Spectacles, frames bearing two lenses worn in front of the eyes
A pair of lenses in a frame that are worn in front of the eyes and are used to correct faulty vision or protect the eyes.

bn:00006125n: Clothing is material used to cover parts of the human body for protection against the environment, for comfort and body modesty, and as personal decoration, often reflecting religious, cultural, and social customs.
Clothing is fiber and textile material worn on the body.
All coverings designed to be worn on a person's body.
Something that can be worn; an item of clothing.
A covering of or like clothing.
An act or instance of putting clothes on.
A covering designed to be worn on a person's body
Fiber and textile material worn on the body

bn:00032512n: An organ of vision that detects light
Organ that detects light and converts it into electro-chemical impulses in neurons
The two eyes of a human being considered as a whole.
A window or other opening that has an oval or circular shape (as of an eye).
An organ through which animals see.
Eyes are sensory organs of the face responsible for sight.
An oculus, plural oculi, from Latin oculus: eye, denotes a circular opening in the center of a dome or in a wall.
Eyes are the organs of vision.
The part of the eye having a spherical shape.
The organ that is sensitive to light, which it converts to electrical signals passed to the brain, by which means animals see.

bn:00057311n: Descriptive term, often used pejoratively, indicating that a person is overly intellectual, obsessive, or socially impaired
Nerd is a descriptive term, often used pejoratively, indicating that a person is overly intellectual, obsessive, or socially impaired.
A person who is intellectual but generally introverted
An intelligent but single-minded expert in a particular technical field or profession
An intelligent but single-minded expert in a particular technical field or profession.

bn:00033731n: Fashion refers to styles of dress that are popular in a culture at any given time.
The latest and most admired style in clothes and cosmetics and behavior
Term for a popular style or practice in clothing, make-up, furniture, etc.
The latest and most admired style in clothes and cosmetics and behavior.
Fashion is a popular style or practice, especially in clothing, footwear, accessories, makeup, body piercing, or furniture.
A prevailing mode of expression, e.g., clothing

apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the glasses emoji showcases a pair of classic, black-rimmed spectacles rendered with Apple's signature glossy 3D shading and smooth gradients. The lenses appear clear and reflective, capturing subtle light glints that add to their realism and depth, while the soft rounded edges of the frame lend a friendly, approachable feel. This emoji on Apple devices often signifies intellect, perception, or the act of seeing clearly, commonly used when discussing vision, knowledge, or something that requires close attention.
